qas.question: Who manned the Cubs radio and TV booth for parts of five decades?
What was Jack Brickhouse's trademark call?
What did Jack Brickhouse do when he approached his retirement age?

context: <a0_0>Jack Brickhouse<a0_0/> manned the Cubs radio and especially the TV booth for parts of five decades, the 34-season span from 1948 to 1981. He covered the games with a level of enthusiasm that often seemed unjustified by the team's poor performance on the field for many of those years. His trademark call "<a1_0>Hey Hey!<a1_0/>" always followed a home run. That expression is spelled out in large letters vertically on both foul pole screens at Wrigley Field. "Whoo-boy!" and "Wheeee!" and "Oh, brother!" were among his other pet expressions. When he approached retirement age, <a2_0>he personally recommended his successor<a2_0/>.
